pros:
Friendly working environment
State of the art technologies
cons: Expect low Compensation and standard salary

pros: Excellent place to work, except for the burocracy.
cons: To much Burocracy, as well as all big company.

pros: Comfortable work environment and flexible hours
cons: Not any significant cons. Moslty no cons

pros: Gain experience with laboratory support
cons: A lot of studies are required

pros: Good work culture and teams
cons: Too much work load and independent work

job_title: Research Fellow in Freiburg im Breisgau
pros: It is full of nice pros
cons: There is no kontras found

pros: everything is good about it
cons: nothing is bad about it

pros: Good onboarding and supervision, very nice.
cons: Very academically focussed, not really business-oriented

pros:
Working at the institute gave me the benefit of having a free and communicative environment and work culture.
You have enough freedom to be responsible for your own tasks and get the chance to gain higher responsibilities.
I was supported in my personal development concerning professional and social experience.
cons: Due to the nature of Fraunhofer beeing a research institute some projects might take a change in their direction very late in development process or can also be stopped or totally fail. Many of these projects may only be completed for a (public) test phase and never comercial viability. This can be disappointing. When compared to industrial companies in the same field of expertise the payments can be lower.

review_title: Large experimental company with small teams, but lacking support - Intern
pros:
Working for a software development area of the company I was able to learn a lot of new technologies I wouldn't have gotten at a more corporate, time driven company.

A lot of independence was given to me as an intern.

Friendly staff which seemed to have been working very well together.

Family atmosphere.

Flexible hours.
cons:
Too much independence turned into a lack of support. I was left with zero training from the start, thrown in the deep end as well as no long term support.

Given individual project rather than working as a part of a team.

German bureaucracy. 

Terribly low wages for interns.

review_title: Great place to prepare for an industry or academic career
pros: Great opportunity to work in interesting and international development and research projects, lots of freedom (but ones has to be able to make use of it), allows building a big set of contacts into academia and industry
cons: Time management can be very difficult among varying responsibilities such as writing proposals, doing development work and furthering one's scientific career. Expect to work a bit more than 40 hrs if you plan to get a PhD while working here.

pros: Instead of menial tasks like stapling documents and making coffee, students are given real work to do on production systems. As a result, there's lots of room to learn (especially about project management) and grow.
cons:
The pay is lower than what you would find at other companies, especially considering the work the students do. The upside is that the Fraunhofer name is nice to have on a resume after graduating.

The student to full-time employee ratio is a bit lopsided. Given the lack of work experience most students have, things can get a bit chaotic at times.

pros:
- you get exposed to interesting projects (though more by chance than in a planned fashion)
- work with some pretty good people
- get to go to conferences if you're lucky
- can do PhD besides normal paid job
cons:
- top level management completely indifferent to daily operations
- no employee education/training at all
- little guidance for PhD, your pretty much on your own
- no communication from bottom up, only top-down orders

review_title: PhD at Fraunhofer is a big challenge
pros: you work on industry projects beside your PhD research, and your research is industry oriented, which gives you an advantage if you aim to work in the industry after completion of the PhD. A guaranteed job offer upon completion of the PhD.
cons: Salaries are low for PhD students (half position offers), and the work load is very high, as they are required to do the same project work done by other colleagues in addition to their PhD work in just a 3 year period. Rare cases of contract extensions if the PhD is not finished within 3 years.

pros:
- chance to get involved directly in projects with industry
- good chances for networking
- asset as work experience in CV
cons:
- all the bureaucratic drawbacks met in public (or partly public) companies 
- huge delays , sometimes just unjustifiable
- very little opportunities to get some permanent position (apart from short term contracts and some PhD positions)
- salary quite below industry standards

review_title: Good place to learn about project management and technology development - for a few years
pros: Great colleagues. There is a high responsibility given to you in managing projects, and the team and the senior managers will always have your back if you need them. It is overall a great learning experience.
cons: You can't really advance. Te salary is poor compared to the industry.

pros:
Great amount of responsibility given. Access to resources, including journals and workshop for machining.
The experience was priceless, and definitely resulted in a huge change for myself, becoming more confident as an Engineer.
cons:
Not much interaction between the students and permanent employers. Though the employers are all friendly and always happy to help. 
Salary for students is low, but the value you get from the experience is definitely worth it.

review_title: Overall, they seem to be a good company and they are focused on the big projects they are doing.
pros: It was a good place to work at as it was located in Germany, a lot of benefits was provided to its workers. They are also working on some big projects currently.
cons: Like in every other company, there was a bit of problem with project management. There were problems that no one knew how to solve, and you had to grind away at it yourself.

review_title: A place to learn, work and have fun
pros: Since its a Research institute, one can learn a lot in Solar field, from production to installation. Being one of the top Solar research instiute, it has many tie ups with other similar institute.
cons: During winter, its difficult to work. Also because of constant snow, life becomes difficult for those who travels in trams, buses, and bikes.

job_title: Internship to Develop An Optical Coherence Tomograpy in Aachen
pros:
Infrastructure is complete, containing new computers and a lot of support with new versions of softwares.

There is more than enough resources to research, and the company is willing to invest in projects that prove to be viable.They are always open to hear new ideas and invest in the good ones.
cons: There isn't anything that i can complain about the company, i can put as Cons, the fact that the company is in Aachen, a good city but it isn't a big city.

pros:
- Fraunhofer HHI is focused on attractive research topics
- many colleagues with whom one can discuss research related issues
- well equipped (in some areas)
- a paradise for a happy few
cons:
- too young and non-experienced management
- management staff is completely overextended and tends to compensate helplessness by agression and arrogance
- no strategy, short-termed objectives dominate everything
- research areas of strategic importance are disestablished (e.g. user centric approaches)
- culture is driven by fear (e.g. pressure by management and loosing the job)
- in some areas very old equipment (missing investments)
- carreer perspectives: none

pros:
Good experience. Got to work with a lot of new technology and learned a lot. At that time, they were making goal like technology for Bundesliga and FiFA 2014 worldcup and it was good experience to see closely this new technology. 
Great labs to do research
cons: It was too much research based. Not a lot of strict deadlines. Everybody leaves the office at 5 which showed to me that people are not that ambitious but its germany and germans are super efficient.

job_title: Research Assistant in Freiburg im Breisgau
pros: It is a great warm place, the people that already work there are very accepting and you work in an international environment, There are a lot of extra curricular activities that take place in different buildings or even after work which help you become a part of the team more easily.
cons: Some of the meetings are held fully in German so unless you have a decent knowledge of it, it is hard to keep up.

review_title: Interesting opportunities, but work environment is heavily dependend on institute & department
pros: As a researcher at Fraunhofer you have the freedom to reasearch and try out new technologies.
cons: In the field of Computer Science a lot of innovation comes from the industry. In several areas the big American companies (Google, Facebook,...) are a step ahead. Also, from my experience there is a lack of young talented software engineers; some departments have an average employee age above 50 yr.

pros: Flexible working time, good project, possibility of changing a project, experienced supervisors, research approach to the analyzed problems, very reasonable deadlines.
cons: The mensa at work could be better. The company does not organize many events for workers. The contract is issued only for a limited amount of time.

pros: Give time to learn new things, understanding, supportive, friendly
cons:
- Sometime it is too relaxed to work and lots of paper work than real work. 
- University of Applied Sciences (FH) students are not considered/encouraged to be first choice for researcher or PhD program although no matter how much they delivers.

pros: Industrial experience that you can gain while doing your PhD. Also, you can learn to sell science at Fraunhofer which gives you an edge over other academic scientists.
cons: For all your handwork compensation is negligible. Also if you are doing a PhD side by side it always takes a long to complete as your focus suffers because of other project commitments.

pros: * good as first job, it has good reputation in germany, sometimes possibility to do phd, between academic and inddustry, not very stressfull
cons: *is almost impossible to get permanent contract, salaries are average or less then average comparing to industry, alot of adminisrative work

pros: It is a great oppurtunity to work at fraunhofer. Since it is an industry, there are a lot of industrial collaborations done to ensure research with maximum yield.
cons: The department is mostly busy working on and there is limited space to relax . But this wouldhelp you gain a lot during the limited time

pros:
Time flexibility & variety of projects (not just a single product to support for years).
Friendly atmosphere.
cons: Software development process is weak. No clear roles (flat hierarchy and low motivation). Rotation of employees impacts the quality of the software.

pros:
- Freedom to test new ideas
- Flexible working hours
- Good working ambiance
- Excellent facilities
- Applied research
- Possibility to later found your own company
cons:
- Low salary
- No chance to get higher position
- Sometimes bad managing
- Retrograde compensation system
- Unfair (not logical) rules for project/investment acquisition

job_title: Student Job As C++ Software Developer in Kaiserslautern
pros: Bettter compensation than university and other research institutes(e.g. DFKI), friendly environment, flexibility of work hours, many company facilities.  Most of the things depend on you and your superwiser.
cons: No smart key, No entry after 1800, high expectation, no formal process. There are no further opportunities. Some of my friends got job in the institute, but is not always a case.

pros: New, modern and nicely made building, with very well planned rooms, offices and public areas (gym, mensa, etc.).
cons: Very out-of-date way of working and communicating. Place with only German speakers, emails, meetings and company events are in German (although there were positions opened in English without requirement of speaking German). Very low level of science in many groups, group leaders in fields without any experience. Lack of flexibility and open discussion on many levels. Very slow way of working.

pros:
it is very well know institute
it look great on any cv
flexible working hours
good work environment in offices,
cons:
not coming in my mind right now
maybe they can give more salaries to workers
maybe they can be more reliable

pros: Chance of working on challenging technologies. The team mates are helpful and find more space for your own opinion
cons: More tight schedules, and expect more from you. If you are not technical upto the mark, you will find difficult time here.

review_title: Good Place to work at, varies from Department to departmen
pros:
Relaxed, no stress in general. Although sometimes
Flexible working hours
People oriented if you are a fulltimer
Secure if you get a permanent contract since this is considered a public organization
cons:
Lack of time management and resources utilization
Many projects are only research projects and not really industrial ones
Salary is lower than industrial average

pros: International environment with interesting people. It offers the possibility to work in interesting research projects. Good work-life balance. Possibility for training.
cons: Management could be improved since sometimes the objectives were not clearly defined. A more formal project management process could be implemented to improve performance.

pros:
Freedom to define and organize your tasks
Good work-life balance possible
cons:
Administration is too powerful in the institute
Very slow HR processes - Employees are not treated as valuable assets
Older Employees on permanent contracts are sometimes not motivated to innovate, young employees with fixed term contract struggle to get a indefinite contract
Low salary, not performance incentives

review_title: All in one: nice place to work, with a world wide appeal as a research institue with state-of-the-art research topics
job_title: Research Engineer in Freiburg im Breisgau
pros: Leading edge research topics; Great office equipment; Nice working atmosphere; Work life balance; Job security
cons: Limited career steps; Moderate Salary; Low benefit offers;

pros: comfortable atmosphere. jerk free environment. decide your own work hours. Budget always available for ordering new hardware.
cons: Bad relations to Infrastructure team. low salary. sometimes too much bureaucracy. work is too monotone and not always challenging. Campus is far away from city center. no flawless communication between the employees level and the far higher management level.

pros: If you have a topic you like you can work as you want. Good work-life-balance.
cons: Very bureaucratic, years of employment count more than the quality of your ideas, be nice and say yes and you can proceed. Not a very good culture.

pros: Very friendly people, always give you time to focus in your exams
cons: Organizational structure is more or less a mess. Everyone is working in everything, and not focused in particular project. If you are a junior and you have a problem, you do not really know whom to ask.

pros: Flexible work environment with great colleagues, although this will obviously depend on your group. Everyone seems to be friendly and I found the work environment to be very professional.
cons: Sometimes a lack of focus in certain groups. Endless paper work and formalities.

pros: Relaxed atmosphere.  Friendly colleagues!
cons: Work is not so exciting! Most of the time I have very few to do. Also no active training for students! The experience depends completely on your direct supervisor!

review_title: Great place to get experience while studying
pros: Good work atmosphere, flexible work hours, focused but relaxed atmosphere, good and constructive error culture, modern workspaces, feeling of being valuable for the department, adequate increase in responsibilities over the course of the employment
cons: Little possibilities to convert to full-time employment, limited development possibilities

review_title: Great work environment. Good team spirit, helpful colleagues and great place to learn.
job_title: Scientific Assistant in Freiburg im Breisgau
pros: Great work environment. Good team spirit, helpful colleagues and great place to learn. Top level research. Challenging opportunities to work on.
cons: HR support is limited during visa applications etc. Finding a house is extremely difficult in the city.

job_title: Group Leader R&D in Karlsruhe, Baden-Wurttemberg
pros: Room for personal improvement, challenging job, different work every day, good working climate and  smart people all around.
cons: payment could be much better, there are not many institutes outside of Germany, so it is not easy to get international experience

pros:
Offers a friendly environment with private offices working as think tanks. Free coffee too!
Flexible working hours!
cons: Need self motivation to work!There is not much to dislike in working there, except that we are under paid.

job_title: Student Job As Data Analyst in Kaiserslautern
pros: The working environment is calm and would be heaven for a person who loves to work without so much pressure. Although, the situation could be different in other departments of Fraunhofer,
cons: Research oriented institutes could be boring for some people to work with.

review_title: Good for experience , bad for money

good team work atmosphere
gaining good experience
working in a friendly atmosphere

Wants you to work as full time with a 40 hours contract they don t say it directly but in the deep conversation you can understand that

review_title: This is where you can build your reputation and career
pros: Lots of individual freedom, direct working relationships with management levels and executives, ability to take on leadership and responsibility at an early point.
cons: Remuneration is rather low and lots of traveling may be required.

review_title: Fraunhofer Gesellschaft is a very interesting employer
pros: As a research assistant you are involved in some interesting (EU-) projects, can see the newest technology achievements
cons: You have rather to work independently with a little supervision, there is not a lot of team work

pros: Great place to work if you love your work and love writing proposals and love the challenge of securing your own funding.
cons: It is your responsibility to get your own funding through government grants and industry partners through proposals.

pros: Nice offices, nice colleagues. Not a high-pressure environment. Good place for a student to earn some good money and work on interesting assigments in a respectful environment.
cons: As a student assistant, there were no real cons at Fraunhofer.

pros: Flexible office hours, freedom to pursue your own ideas, a lot of opportunities to extend your skills, great health benefits

review_title: Senior Management in search of a strategy

lack of strategy, no career opportunities. 
Intransparent and unfair: benefits are given to a small group of people (because they know each other, not because of good work).

pros: Good Work Atmosphere. Free to try and design things on your own. Flat Hierarchy. Good to place to make more contacts

job_title: Mixed signal IC designer in Dresden

pros: Very flexible with respect to timings and work. The management is very understanding and extremely supportive.

pros: Interesting and diverse tasks; A lot of freedom to explore what you like; Very friendly colleagues; Taking responsibility from early on

pros: Great working environment, highly flexible timings, great minds and great projects

pros:
